verse:
न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा |
इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते || 14||
transliteration: na māṁ karmāṇi limpanti na me karma-phale spṛihāiti māṁ yo ’bhijānāti karmabhir na sa badhyate
word meanings: na—not; mām—me; karmāṇi—activities; limpanti—taint; na—nor; me—my; karma-phale—the fruits of action; spṛihā—desire; iti—thus; mām—me; yaḥ—who; abhijānāti—knows; karmabhiḥ—result of action; na—never; saḥ—that person; badhyate—is bound
translation: Actions do not taint Me, nor have I a desire for the fruit of actions. He who knows Me thus is not bound by actions.
commentary: God is all-pure, and whatever he does also becomes pure and auspicious. The Ramayan states:samaratha kahuñ nahiṅ doṣhu gosāīṅ, rabi pāvaka surasari kī nāīṅ. [v15]“Pure personalities are never tainted by defects even in contact with impure situations and entities, like the sun, the fire, and the Ganges.” The sun does not get tainted if sunlight falls on a puddle of urine. The sun retains its purity, while also purifying the dirty puddle. Similarly, if we offer impure objects into the fire, it still retains its purity—the fire is pure, and whatever we pour into it also gets purified. In the same manner, numerous gutters of rainwater merge into the holy Ganges, but this does not make the Ganges a gutter—the Ganges is pure and in transforms all those dirty gutters into the holy Ganges. Likewise, God is not tainted by the activities he performs.Activities bind one in karmic reactions when they are performed with the mentality of enjoying the results. However, God’s actions are not motivated by selfishness; his every act is driven by compassion for the souls. Therefore, although he administers the world directly or indirectly, and engages in all kinds of activities in the process, he is never tainted by any reactions. Lord Krishna states here that he is transcendental to the fruitive reactions of work.Even Saints who are situated in God-consciousness become transcendental to the material energy. Since all their activities are effectuated in love for God, such pure-hearted Saints are not bound by the fruitive reactions of work. The Śhrīmad Bhāgavatam states:yat pāda paṅkaja parāga niṣheva tṛiptāyoga prabhāva vidhutākhila karma bandhāḥsvairaṁ charanti munayo ’pi na nahyamānāstasyechchhayātta vapuṣhaḥ kuta eva bandhaḥ(10.33.35) [v16]“Material activities never taint the devotees of God who are fully satisfied in serving the dust of his lotus feet. Nor do material activities taint those wise sages who have freed themselves from the bondage of fruitive reactions by the power of Yog. So where is the question of bondage for the Lord himself who assumes his transcendental form according to his own sweet will?”
new_commentary: In the commentary of the Bhagavad Gita, it is explained that God is all-pure and unaffected by impurities. Just like the sun remains pure even if its light shines on a dirty puddle, God retains his purity while purifying everything around him. Activities bind people in karmic reactions when performed with selfish motives, but God's actions are driven by compassion and do not result in any negative consequences. Saints who are completely devoted to God are also unaffected by material energy and the consequences of their actions. The devotees who serve God's lotus feet and the liberated sages who have attained freedom from karmic bondage are not tainted by material activities. Therefore, the question of bondage does not arise for the Lord himself, as he remains transcendental and unaffected by any actions he performs.
newest_commentary: The commentary explains that God is pure and unaffected by impurities. Like the sun shining on a dirty puddle, God remains pure while purifying everything. Selfish actions lead to karmic reactions, but God's compassionate actions have no negative consequences. Saints devoted to God and liberated sages are unaffected by material energy. Those who serve God's feet and the liberated sages are not influenced by material activities. The Lord remains transcendent and unaffected by any actions he performs, so he is not bound by bondage. God's purity and compassionate actions cleanse without being tainted by impurities or consequences.
